Name: Prohibiting allowances in addition to salary for council members.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter in relation to prohibiting allowances in addition to salary for council members.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Subdivision b of section 26 of the New York City charter is amended to read as follows:
	b. The salary of each council  member  shall  be  one  hundred  twelve  thousand  five  hundred  dollars a year. No allowances, including allowances for [In addition any council member,  while] serving as  a  committee  chairperson  or  other  officer  of  the  council,  may  [also]  be  paid,  in addition to such salary[, an allowance  fixed by resolution, after a hearing, for the particular and  additional  services pertaining to the additional duties of such position].
	Â§2.  This local law shall take effect on the first day of January of the year immediately following its approval by vote of the electorate.
